results.title: Your Money
results.brief_description: We all need money, we all use money. In the everchanging financial climate, it’s becoming more and more important to have a sound understanding of money management. The difference between those of us who achieve our financial goals and those of us who don’t, can be measured in a few simple roles. It’s easy. “Your Money” is an easy to understand, step by step guide, to making better financial decisions when - saving, borrowing,

results.title: Your money
results.brief_description: This program presented by Margaret Throsby and via interviews with managers of various financial institutions suggest ways for the average man in the street to be informed about good money management. We need to look around at the various means available in order to obtain the best vaulue for money with our personal finances. The following topics are covered :- Budgeting, this ensures we see just where our money goes, Savings accounts, either a simple or compound interest account, Taxation and Inflation, the effects on the economy of the country and how they can erode our savings, Investments or enforced saving such as home ownership or superannuation.

results.title: Your local council
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board, John Martin-Jones and Bern Gandy
results.brief_description: Reviews the work of local councils in Australia in providing essential services and amenities in the community. Outlines the services provided by local government. Includes interesting scenes of city and country life and times of the early 1950’s in Eastern Australia.

results.title: Your house in order?
results.creator_credit: Millbank Films, David Evans and Philip Owtram
results.brief_description: Deals with a neglected subject - industrial housekeeping - and the accidents that can be attributed either directly or indirectly to bad housekeeping methods. It sets out to promote the right attitude of mind.

results.title: Your hair and scalp
results.creator_credit: World Wide, Hindle Marriott Edgar and Ken Woodward
results.brief_description: Animated diagrams showing the structure of hair, the process of growth and how to care for one’s hair. Natural variations of hair are shown and artificial treatments. The importance of cleanliness and good grooming in maintaining both health and appearance is emphasised.

results.title: Your Guide to Antique Shopping in Britain
results.brief_description: Your Guide to Antique Shopping in Britain is a fact-filled hour of useful and discerning information for people interested in all forms of antique collecting. Where better to go than one of the great cultural, antique and fine-arts centres of the world? Rated: G

results.title: Your full attention please (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Examines research in the field of human attention with the focus on the apparent ability of some people to share their attention between two or more tasks at the same time.

results.title: Your friends and neighbors
results.creator_credit: PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Steve Golin, Jason Patric and Neil LaBute
results.brief_description: Neil Labute’s (“In the company of men”, “Nurse Betty”) second feature is a caustic, bleak study of sexual dysfunction and alienation amongst six casually connected friends and lovers. Labute’s brittle screenplay wanders between one relationship horror show to another as these hapless ‘friends and neighbours’ try to connect with each other through a series of empty sexual encounters and misguided affairs. Terri (Catherine Keener) can’t stand the fact that her husband Jerri (Ben Stiller) makes a lot of noise when they make love. Terri starts an affair with Cheri (Nastassja Kinski), a sensitive art gallery curator who’s neediness and insecurity requires constant validation. Jerri on the other hand finds himself infatuated with Mary (Amy Brenneman), his best friends wife. Mary’s husband Barry (Aaron Eckhart) claims the best sex he has ever had is with himself and is frustrated by his wife’s lack of sex drive. All the while Barry and Jerri’s predatory and narcissistic single friend Cary (Jason Patric) dishes out his own brand of misogynous rough justice with the countless women he sleeps with.
results.creator_credit_for_label: PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Steve Golin, Jason Patric and Neil LaBute
